New Records: Juan Soto hit a three-run homer in the top of the 10th inning, breaking the tie and securing the Yankees' victory.
Giancarlo Stanton hit a two-run home run in the sixth inning, tying the game at 2-2.
Key Match Events: Juan Soto's three-run homer in the 10th inning was the game-winning blow.
Giancarlo Stanton's two-run home run in the sixth inning gave the Yankees an early lead.
Carlos Bibee pitched 5 2/3 scoreless innings, the longest outing by a Cleveland starter this month.
Emmanuel Clase retired Aaron Judge and Stanton in the ninth inning, preserving the tie.
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees were expected to return to the World Series with the acquisition of Juan Soto.
Manager Aaron Boone emphasized Stanton's disciplined approach and physicality as key factors in the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Hal Steinbrenner celebrated the Yankees' first AL Championship since 2009.
Emmanuel Clase, despite previous struggles, was praised by his manager for his resilience.
Miscellaneous Highlights: A costly base-running mistake by the Yankees early in the game led to a missed opportunity for an early lead.
The Yankees made 10 straight outs after the first inning, showcasing their defensive capabilities.
Others: The game marked the Yankees' return to the World Series, ending a 15-year wait.
The article highlights the pivotal moments and performances that defined the game.
